website_summaries.verdict: This entry-level tuner provides surprisingly reliable service for its price point. Guitarists can keep one in the case, one in the classroom, and one in the studio.
pros: Ideal as an affordable classroom or rehearsal room tuner
More accurate than a phone app tuner
Will also transpose keys, and includes a tap tempo metronome
cons: Should not be used on instruments with nitrocelluose finishes
Specific low to high tuning method
Clip-on mount is not always sturdy or secure

customer_reviews.title: Simply, Easy, Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: I played the violin for years as a child but was never taught to tune it. This product is so simple to use and I get a perfect tune every time. My 9 year old is learning right now how to keep her violin in tune and sounding amazing independently. Very happy with the simplicity and ease of use.
customer_reviews.author: amy mccay

customer_reviews.title: Broke with first use.
customer_reviews.text: It works just fine. However, I just received it today, clipped it on the head of my guitar and the unit broke right off its mount where it swivels. It took no effort at all for it to break. I was simply turning it so I could see the screen. Now I cannot use the Snark as it no longer will attach to ball at the end of the swivel. I am seriously bummed. .
customer_reviews.author: Shezmaster

customer_reviews.title: Broke immediately!
customer_reviews.text: Seemed to be easy to use. I took it out of the box, clipped it to my guitar, gently adjusted it to view the display and it broke. The ball joint where the tuner connects to the arm of the clip if defective. Tried to return but was told it is ineligible to be returned. Waiting for further assistance from Amazon. Very disappointed! Amazon responded quickly and is refunding me the amount of my purchase. Thank you customer support!
customer_reviews.author: R. Teaney

customer_reviews.title: Will not tune E string on Bass Guitar.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I purchased. Both of them would not tune the E string on my bass. They seem like knock offs because the one I purchased from GC has worked perfectly for over 2 years. These even seem to be made of a different type of plastic. Beware, because they are not returnable on Amazon, however they did send me a replacement... (that didnt work either btw)
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: SN1 is more accurate
customer_reviews.text: In a pinch the SN5X will get you in the ballpark, but if you need something for more than practice, this is not the tuner for you. I own the SN1, but it was accidentally packed in storage when I moved. I figured the 5X would be just as good, and a lot easier to just get this little guy rather than have to dig through a million boxes in storage. Unfortunately, that is not the case. I can't even remember why I chose this over just getting another SN1 (probably thought it wouldn't matter? Or liked it in black? Not sure), but my recommendation would be to go Blue or don't bother.
customer_reviews.author: Indiegrrl74

customer_reviews.title: I already own two older ones that work fine. I tried using brand new batteries and still ...
customer_reviews.text: Ordered and received two snark guitar, bass, violin tuners. Neither works. I already own two older ones that work fine. I tried using brand new batteries and still nothing. They are both defective items. Disappointed because the older ones I have work perfectly. Now amazon is saying I can't return these items. Disappointed snark customer.
customer_reviews.author: RR

customer_reviews.title: Simply and effective over years of testing
customer_reviews.text: I used Smark for my guitars for many years. Finally, the two I used died. I tried others like it that were supposedly better. Not so. I found most of the tuners to be problematic in the settings and recognition of tunings. Make one error in button tap and you're changing everything. I like to just sit, tune, and play. I shift between C, Drop D, and standard tunings. I tossed all of my other tuners and purchased the Smark again. It has been super. I will not change again. Even a rack mount tuner requires some moments of time that take away from my playing. I like simple and effective. Smark is great, bright, and accurate for me.
customer_reviews.author: Blackstar5

customer_reviews.title: Pretty disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I’m super bummed about this tuner. I bought it about a month ago but didn’t use it straight away sincerely my guitar is in the shop. I have used others and loved them so bought this one with high hopes. It doesn’t know what string I’m on and jumps around from note to note. Would not consider it accurate... obviously. I guess I’ll have to buy something else, but won’t be another one of these. All in all, I’m disappointed since these seem like the coolest tuners about.
customer_reviews.author: Corin

customer_reviews.title: NO METRONOME. TUNER WORKS. MISLEADING DESCRIPTION.
customer_reviews.text: Today the Snark SN-5X arrived. The description says it has a tap tempo metronome. That is the reason I chose this unit. Now I find out it doesn't have that feature. Would have ordered a different model. The tuner part works fine but I need the metronome. YOU NEED TO CHANGE THE DESCRIPTION AND REMOVE THE METRONOME FEATURE!
customer_reviews.author: JLA

customer_reviews.title: Ugly but effective.
customer_reviews.text: Tbh I don't think there's a dumber looking clamp-on tuner in the world, the product name is one of the worst created ("Snark"!"), and I think it's ugly as sin...but it does what it's supposed to do. The need to stay in tune and have a cheap/durable/utilitarian tuner that's so big and ugly you're sure to not lose it sometimes outweighs the need to be cool. Just don't leave it clamped on your guitar's headstock if you're gigging or playing out. Rotten food and beer bottles will get thrown at you, and rightfully so.
customer_reviews.author: D.M.

customer_reviews.title: Has one feature that sets it apart
customer_reviews.text: Ok, I' read all these rave reviews about this tuner. Honestly, as a tuner it is not any better than Fender or other brands. I said it, and I stand by it. However, I replaced 5, all my guitar tuners with this one. Why? Because there is on feature that sets it apart: It takes on click to turn it on and off. I hated having to hold down a on or off button for 3 or 4 seconds to operate the other brands. If you can stand that, keep your old tuner.
customer_reviews.author: M. baggett

customer_reviews.title: Does not accurately tune a guitar
customer_reviews.text: I bought this device so I could tune my electric guitar without having to plug a cord into a standard tuner. After I first used the Snark, I noticed my guitar sounded out-of-tune despite this tuner indicating the guitar was in-tune. I then plugged my guitar into a standard guitar tuner and discovered the guitar was significantly out-of-tune despite the Snark tuner indicating it was in-tune. An inaccurate tuner is useless, so this purchase was a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Like this tuner...But
customer_reviews.text: Actually works better than I thought for bass guitar. I use this at home for quick tuning. Didn't last 6-months. After I changed the battery, it stopped working. Buying one more. If that one breaks during a battery change, I'm done with the Snark.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Potts

customer_reviews.title: Small, affordable, accurate, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: It’s a very good, affordable tuner that’s stupid easy to use and simple to read. The display is bright and the tuning is accurate. The only problem I had with it is the cheap rubber shoe on the clamp that came off in the first week. I almost threw it out because I didn’t know what it went to. Luckily I held onto it and discovered it went on the tuner the next time I used it. I’m going to glue it on so it doesn’t fall off again
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: I've had several of these over the years, they're not bad. Sometimes they work great, sometimes they're useless. A lot of times it doesn't give me perfect tuning, but it gets close enough I can finish it myself. Worth the price. The rubber that clips to the guitar came off the first time I used this one. The others I purchased at guitar stores held up great. A little super glue did the trick. I ordered the new polytune clip on tuner recently, seems like it'll last a lot longer. As it should, considering its five times the price
customer_reviews.author: Cullen

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work properly
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these for Christmas, one for my viola-playing son, and one for my cello-playing daughter. BOTH OF THEM do not register a consistent note. At each of their private lessons, we brought the tuners for their instructors to test since we were having such difficulty, and both them of pretty much said these do not work properly, and in fact tune their instruments incorrectly. Don't be fooled like me by the low price and others saying they work for anything other than "guitar, bass, violin" because they simply don't. If I had only bought one, I'd be inclined to think we got a bad one, but since we have two...
customer_reviews.author: Awoo

customer_reviews.title: Simple, works
customer_reviews.text: I am new to tuners, but even so this was easy. A couple of things I noted. Make sure the other strings are mute so the tuner only "hears" the intended one. It also hears fingers sliding around the strings. Also for my high E string, the tuner may briefly read "A" and then read "E". The instructions caution against damaging the guitar's finish, particularly on Gibson guitars. I'll just say that the tuner is light, has rubber pads on the gripping claw, and the gripping power is modest. It must take an extremely delicate finish for there to be an issue.
customer_reviews.author: David B. Jennings

customer_reviews.title: Can tuning get any easier?
customer_reviews.text: I bought this along with a guitar. I've never owned a guitar before let alone tuned one. This device made the process very easy, even for a complete and utter guitar-tuning newbie. It is easy to use and easy to read. Is it accurate? Well, after I used this my my new guitar sounds just like the guy in the video. Before I used it, it didn't. It worked! It's cheap! I'm happy!
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Easy, Convenient, Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this thing! Of course, I grew up in the dark ages, where to tune your guitar, you either had to have perfect pitch, or hope to find a piano somewhere. (Yeah....WAY back then). Of c ourse, now they're quite common. But it is SO nice, easy, convenient, and being I'm playing an old beater of a guitar, on my porch, where the temperature fluctuates wildly, it's great to have it right there (all the time), to quickly tune up.
customer_reviews.author: Aja Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Works great... until it breaks
customer_reviews.text: These are wonderful little tuners, and you will love it.... until it breaks. I've bought a handful of these and don't treat them roughly at all, but the moving parts always fail after a year or two. It's never the electronics, always the gripping mechanism. This product is cheap because they've cut corners when it comes to durability.
customer_reviews.author: Ewan Gillespie

customer_reviews.title: Cheap materials
customer_reviews.text: While the unit itself works well and lights up nicely, the plastic used to anchor the unit to the cilp is so cheap it broke within a week. Now that the unit cannot connect to the clip the thing is useless. Sure I could tape it in place, but I didn't buy this thing to have to rig it up within a week. Spend a little more for quality. Two stars because the tuner itself is really nice. If you're willing to be very careful with this thing you might be ok, but forget about throwing it into a gig bag. It will break.
customer_reviews.author: Ram Fenster

customer_reviews.title: NOT FOR GIBSON GUITARS or those with nitrocellulose finish
customer_reviews.text: NOT FOR GIBSON GUITARS (or those with nitrocellulose finish)!! THANK GOD I READ THE INSTRUCTIONS BEFORE USE! In looking back through all item information listed on Amazon I did notice a small link to DL an owner's manual. THIS IS GUITAR FINISH RUINING INFORMATION THAT A BUYER SHOULDN'T have to HUNT for!
customer_reviews.author: HonestShopper

customer_reviews.title: Snark SN5X Clip-On Tuner for Guitar
customer_reviews.text: Works okay. I have to put it down on the headstock closer tot the strings to get good consistent readings. At the end of the headstock of my guitars (electric and acoustic) It seems to not always read it well. When I move it to the sides when tuning it it does great. I also have to move it form one side for the lower strings and the other side for the higher strings. Sometimes can get in the way of the tuners but still a nice set up for not having to plug in and very easy to read. Happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Stiggy

customer_reviews.title: Great tuner, iffy battery life
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tuner a d eliminated a simple but detrimental problem - keeping your guitar in tune! I had the issue of trying to tune my acoustic with other tuners while our drummer was playing but I couldn't tune without telling him to stop playing. This picks up the string perfectly and is very accurate. Only gripe is that the battery doesnt last that long, I've had it for a few months and am already on my second battery, which seems weird to me. I've made sure to turn the tuner off after tuning so it doesnt drain.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Bertelli

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this tuner
customer_reviews.text: There are many tuners out there, and I have tried only three, and only two of those were clip-ons. What do I like about it? Clip on tuners are very convenient. Also, they don't work via a microphone -- they pick up the vibrations from the headstock, so you can tune it even with the volume down, even if someone else is playing loudly while you are tuning. The other thing I appreciate about it, and why I picked it, some tuners have about 7 bars to show how sharp or flat you are. I didn't count exactly, but this one has something like 27 graduations.
customer_reviews.author: James Battle

customer_reviews.title: Great price. They work.
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price. The HZ Model is brighter and tighter, but they cost three times as much. As with all clip on tuners, they are not hard to break. That's why I buy these cheaper ones. Hint: The ones I have broken, broke because I forgot to take them off the guitar when I closed the guitar case.
customer_reviews.author: End User

customer_reviews.title: Pay $99 for a good inline tuner if you have an electric guitar.  This is fine for acoustic.
customer_reviews.text: I get a lot more variation that I would like. I will have to buy an inline tuner. I'm pretty careful to pick my strings consistently. I stretch and seat the strings well, and use Tusq XL nuts. Why then do I get so much variation? While it is probably close enough, I'm a perfectionist and really want to dial my intonation in well. I find the readings too erratic on all of the headstock tuners. But it does what it is supposed to do within proper limits. If you have an electric guitar, pay the extra money and get and inline tuner.
customer_reviews.author: Conrad

customer_reviews.title: Broke within days
customer_reviews.text: This is the second of this type tuner I have purchased. I loved the functionality but the display failed on the first after a couple years so I ordered this one to replace it. It was either defective when it arrived or failed within the first month. The plastic that the screw which holds the two halves together broke causing the two halves to be loose. without a tight fit, the battery doesn't make connection and the unit looses power. The quality of construction is not good. I am shopping today for a replacement from another manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Hale

customer_reviews.title: Not built for long term use
customer_reviews.text: I took it out of the drawer after four months of inactivity. It was covered in a greasy film, despite being stored in its pouch. After cleaning it I attached it to my guitar and it broke at the ball joint. Maybe I scrubbed it too vigorously but this kind of product should be able to survive the sometimes rough and tumble world of music.
customer_reviews.author: Harrold M.

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job great!
customer_reviews.text: Works welll, the digits are nice and big, easy to read. Great product for the price. No need two spend a bunch of money for something you have one basic use for, this guitar, bass, viloin tuner does the job at low cost! I own two now, and the way their design makes them very susceptible to damage on any impact. I've had my first one for at least 2 years; but guitar fell with it & broke something; so it works but its falling apart as you can tell from the photos. I would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Ovando

customer_reviews.title: Accurate?  Sounds accurate...
customer_reviews.text: How would I know if the tuning is accurate. I use this Snark tuner to tune my axe accurately. Sounds in tune and that’s enough for me. I tune one LP style guitar, one Harley Benton Extreme-76, one Aria ac-15 40 year old acoustic Guitar and one ukulele. All sound fine. The tuner just clips to the end of the head with a non-marking clip, push the on/off button and tune to your hearts content. Easy to read with two or three colors to boot.
customer_reviews.author: R. SAFRENOTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: CLIP IT ON THE BRIDGE OF MY CELLO
customer_reviews.text: Quick and easy to use. I just clip it on the bridge of my cello and it takes about 30 seconds to tune all four strings, even if I have new strings that are still stretching, or if the weather has changed. I use it every day at home before and sometimes during practice, and I am in orchestra and we tune to 440, so by the time the oboe gives an A, I am all ready to go. If you need to tune to, say, 442, you can do that too. Buttons on the back. I don’t leave home without my Snark.
customer_reviews.author: A. Nony MooseTop Contributor: Golf

customer_reviews.title: Great, until it broke 😢
customer_reviews.text: I originally gave it 5 stars... until it broke for no apparent reason. Ok, so it works well and it is so much easier than using a foot pedal or, worse, a stand alone tuner that requires you to (re)plug a cable. However, mine already broke!! The screen is made to swivel on an “ball joint”. One of the pieces grabbing that ball broke without (much) pressure. And the sad part about these kinds of vibration-based tuners is that it needs to vibrate. So taping it won’t work. Dear manufacturer: can this be replaced so I can go back to ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️?
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: 2 broken in the same way - WARRANTY NOT HONORED.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a second one of these, assuming it was a fluke when the first one's display became increasing dull until it no longer displayed anything (not a battery issue). The exact same thing happened with the replacement. IF yours doesn't break, it's functional, but based on my experience I would suggest people go elsewhere. I emailed them to get a replacement under the warranty. They asked for proof of purchase, which I provided; then they stopped responding.
customer_reviews.author: DJH

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Have two. One new, one a gift from 4 years ago. Did not know they existed until I was given one. Attached one to a classic guitar, the other to an acoustic. If you are still using pitch pipes, the electric organ or your smart phone, it is TIME FOR A CHANGE. These are quick and convenient. They stay attached year round and are ready to go. I like to strum on the porch; humidity and open windows reap havoc on tuning. These make tuning easy. They use a Single flat Coin Battery that last for years.
customer_reviews.author: Critique Extraordinaire ...

customer_reviews.title: To bad so sad
customer_reviews.text: Ok I’ve owned three of these I liked them enough to keep trying but in the end here’s what I found The color (black) simply disappears in any type of stage or gig lighting ! It looks just like everything else you own that is black like wires ,cables,amps speakers you get the picture so I tried the red ones and found they all have the same problem the rubber foot is poorly glued ( All models ) after it falls off ( lost in the dark) snark doesn’t fit or work as well to bad Buy a different tuner
customer_reviews.author: Bone

customer_reviews.title: I got a bad one
customer_reviews.text: Turns on, but doesn't work. Won't read anything. Tried replacing the battery, no go. It's apparently a fairly common problem with these. I have two other ones that work fine. Normally I wouldn't bother to leave a bad review, but I can't go through the regular process to return this through amazon, I am directed to a support link....that also doesn't work. So I'm just gonna eat the 9 bucks and be pissed off about it. Will I buy this tuner again? Probably. But I'm going to go to my local Guitar Center next time so I can be sure it works first.
customer_reviews.author: Michele Q

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly accurate
customer_reviews.text: Considering the variables involved with a clip-on tuner (type of instrument, wood type used on the instrument, type of strings used, etc.) these Snark tuners are surprisingly accurate. With some instruments it can be a challenge of where to clip them (my Ovation acoustic guitars, for example) but if you can clip it on, you can tune it with one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Glunt

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I wish i would have bought one of these a long time ago. I have kids and they are never quiet. This tuner senses the frequency of the string's vibration to tune so it does not require a microphone. This means that even in a noisy house, or on a stage you can quickly re-tune your guitar or bass without having to lock yourself in a quiet room. Display is bright and easy to read, and the swivel neck allows for easy placement and viewing angle.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Needs new battery after 2 years
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for nearly two years. Then the battery died. I had tried a CR2025 battery by mistake and it would not work. Turns out, I needed a CR2032 battery, which is a little thicker than the CR2025 It’s a good product. Used it for tuning a student violin. Works well and is accurate. Pretty simple to use once you get used to it.
customer_reviews.author: Q. Liu

customer_reviews.title: Buy something else
customer_reviews.text: Tuner is less than 2 months old and battery has already died. Normally wouldn't leave a review like this, but when I was considering whether or not to buy it, I did see a number of reviews where others had the exact same problem so be forewarned battery problems may be more than anomaly. As for the device when it was working, it was accurate and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Fortin

customer_reviews.title: Super easy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 10 year old so he could tune is guitar in between lessons. He absolutely loves it and enjoys the fact that it is super easy to use. I would HIGHLY recommend this to anyone who is looking for a tuner. I would buy over and over if need be. ****UPDATE**** It broke. No clue how it broke. Went to get it out of the guitar case one day and it was broken. See picture attached.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Easy to break off and poor design
customer_reviews.text: I've got this tuner for about one month, I would say the design of this tuner is too sad!unreasonable!! AND I can't find a suitable way to clip it to my violin. Like the photos I took, it breaks off so frequently as long as I use a little force to adjust the direction....Even if this disconnected place can be reinstalled back. I'm a bit disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Wella

customer_reviews.title: Awesome must have.
customer_reviews.text: These are are great and I cannot think of any reason not to install them, except if you don't have a drill. The screws that come with them are proprietary and cannot be replaced with others. They were longer than the screws that were install on my Ibanez by about 5/16th inch. I didn't want to chance cracking the wood, even if it was a low probability, so I drilled the holes to specifications. The only thing this set is missing in my opinion are pads. There is no reason they shouldn't include 2 of them. I just used the ones that were installed on my guitar again, but still.
customer_reviews.author: chadjason

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and easy to read
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my son based on reviews, not knowing the product or the best tuner to get. When he opened this on Christmas, his reaction told me I chose a go one one! He asked me if I knew this was the best brand and he immediately sang into the tuner to show me how easy the screen is to read. The colors are bright and the note that appears is large. I’m thankful this was a win for my son.
customer_reviews.author: L.W.

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with a Snark
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one of these things. Nothing wrong with the first, still going strong, after a year and a half, and tuning up my guitars daily. Recently bought a cheap used guitar to leave at work for practice on my break and lunch. Said to myself gotta have a tuner to leave there with it. Got this thing for under ten bucks. Bought a nice little case for it. Comes with a battery. Original battery in my other one lasted about a year. Nice and bright. Easy to use. Where have you been all my life?
customer_reviews.author: kellchris2k

customer_reviews.title: Snark tuners rule
customer_reviews.text: I like the bold bright colors and the revised display bars. It is nice looking and has a well-padded clip which is one of the few critical points on a tuner for me. It mounts easily and turns to whatever angle I need. It came with a hot new battery and tuned my acoustic very well so it meets all my expectations. I have owned many Snark tuners and I have had one break a prong on the rotator ball clasp and a couple that ate up battery power pretty fast, but even with on-board tuners, amplifier built-in tuners, etc. these little tuners are about all I will use.
customer_reviews.author: Wildcat Willie

customer_reviews.title: My favorite tuner
customer_reviews.text: This tuner has given me consistent results over the past few years and I couldn't recommend it more. It's great for tuning in noisy areas as it is placed on the headstock and detects the tuning by the vibration of the neck. Coming from a cheap Fender tuner that often produced questionable tunings if any external sound was heard, this is a great upgrade. I've actually never had to replace the batteries but I assume that will happen in the near future, which is fine.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua T.

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done but slower that my phone
customer_reviews.text: It takes more time to properly tune my guitar. The problem seems to be that the string vibration has to completely die down before it takes another reading. Otherwise if I keep strumming the string the needle doesnt move. Othert than that it achieves pretty good results. Main + is able to tune my guitar even in a noisy room (it seems to work via vibrations and not sound) Main - it takes a bit longer than using my phone app.
customer_reviews.author: Benito Huerta

customer_reviews.title: Um....doesn't work??
customer_reviews.text: This appeared to be an easy "pull the battery tab and clip on and it'll work" kind of a thing. Did all that but it only registered the A string a few times, the D string once, the B string once, and the G string once. And the D, B, and G weren't registering our violin - they were registering me talking or me walking! This did NOT detect our violin except the A string a few times. A complete dud. Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: toevlugsoord

customer_reviews.title: Great because it is uncomplicated
customer_reviews.text: I love these Snark tuners. I just bought two more - I think that makes 5 now - that a parked here and there - left in a guitar case, laying on my desk, left clipped on the headstock of my go-to guitar. What makes them great is they are just simple chromatic tuners - no extra buttons or functions to shift pitch, or see only guitar or mandolin notes,etc. And they are very adjustable so you can keep it in your line of sight.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Webster

customer_reviews.title: The best!
customer_reviews.text: I had a Snark for years, then lost it and bought a different name brand. What a mistake, so I bought this Snark. Unlike the others, the display is VERY bright and non glare. It's very sensitive, so you don't have to keep picking a string and wait for it to give you a reading. Easy to use, easy to see, dependable.
customer_reviews.author: Rov

customer_reviews.title: Best and Most Convenient Tuner
customer_reviews.text: It's a clip-on Snark. Everyone should know what to expect. This is the most convenient/accurate way of tuning acoustics. Playing outside in direct sunlight in the summer is a challenge, though. The tuner is very easy to read inside, but nearly impossible in direct sunlight. I wish that Snark would choose a brighter screen for people who like to play outside.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy B.

customer_reviews.title: works great and is perfectly strong enough
customer_reviews.text: great tuner, small, light, easy to read. perfectly strong enough. you break it, your just too rough with it. You set it in position on the headstock and really not going to be twisting it all over the place after that. it moves around smoothly and will last if you just take your time adjusting it. you really dont need to be twisting it and bending it all over the place after you get it into the position you want in. great price, display is nice and bright, and really accurate.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THIS THING
customer_reviews.text: I play bass guitar. I had an older version Snark clip-on that I dropped and broke. Based on consumer reviews I purchased a different brand (more expensive) tuner to replace the Snark. BAD choice. It didn't work at all when I received it. I didn't even like the way it fit on my bass. Rather than lose more time returning it I quickly ordered this Snark. Received it, pulled out the tab for the battery, clipped it on my bass. E,A,D,G done in less than a minute. Thrilled to have my Snark back. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon L. Bach

customer_reviews.title: The best at this price point.
customer_reviews.text: I found that if you're diligent about immediately turning it off after tuning, the battery last a very long time. I also purchased a significantly more expensive clip on tuner that I prefer for its better accuracy, but I always keep a couple of these around for students to beat up on. And you can't beat how simple it is to use/read. I have the Peterson strobe clip on tuner as well, but it's not for everyone and a less experience player would find it confusing.
customer_reviews.author: SP

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use for electric guitar
customer_reviews.text: I have been using for several months on my electric guitar. It is easy to use. Remember to remove after tuning. According to the instructions, if you leave it on for prolonged period, it might stain your guitar head, though that didn't happen to me (I forgot to remove for a week, and my guitar head still looks ok). Highly recommend for someone who needs quick tuning.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite Musical Accompaniment (Spelling?)
customer_reviews.text: Almost totally tone deaf, I could never strum a guitar without this tool. It used to take me half an hour to tune the six strings to the first "E" string. If I failed to pitch the "E" string correctly, the rest of the tuning failed, too. The Snark took care of that. All I have to do now is to be careful that I do not try to sing in public. Nevertheless, I can strum a few chords and pick a few notes.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth E. George

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I typically tune by ear since I've been playing so many years but as the days tack onto my age my its turning more into a guess, this tuner has helped a lot into getting me in proper tuning a few times. Good for the hobbyist guitarist.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Accurate tuner with a tendency to break
customer_reviews.text: I've been using snark tuners for a long tune because they're very accurate. However, I replace them often because the neck that connects the tuner to the clip is fragile and if you move it around much it will break. If you can avoid moving or stressing that neck, you might be able to have a great tuner for a long time. I haven't figured out that trick though.
customer_reviews.author: gratehouser

customer_reviews.title: Keep any guitar in tune. Use it on electric and acoustic
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these devices, they both give the same results, very useful. Tuning by ear is okay, but not nearly as accurate as these devices. You can also check the tuning at different points on the neck to check the pressure impact (pushing really hard on strings makes them sharp). Also strings that are too light can easily be pushed out of tune. You need one of these if you play a guitar and care about being in tune.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Rogers JGT

customer_reviews.title: Simple solutions are often the best
customer_reviews.text: Clip it on, tune it up, back in business. Quick, easy, reliable. The mechanism is easy to handle, easy to clip on and really easy to see, even with old eyes. I only have one small complaint - it has a harder time sensing the lowest strings on electric bass. I think I will eventually figure out the exact spot or technique to make that work as well as guitar.
customer_reviews.author: Al Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Bright, fast and stable
customer_reviews.text: I have tried a number of chromatic electronic tuners, including an older generation Snark. This one is by far the best of the lot. It has a bright, easy to read display. It picks up the note very quickly and is more stable than other models I have used. By stable, I mean that it tends to deal with harmonic and overtones very well and does not give erratic readings.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Could be better
customer_reviews.text: The guitar tuner app on my phone, i can pluck the next string before the last one is silent and get a normal read. This one you have to mute the last string plucked, wait for the meter to go down, then pluck the other string. Sometimes plucking the string doesn't even bring up a reading. The clamp is not tight at all. Should be way tighter. It has enough padding on it to not run the guitar, so why not make it a lot tighter. But when the conditions are right, it does tune it.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer

customer_reviews.title: It sucks!
customer_reviews.text: Mine sucks, my old Snark had a vibrate and a audio switch. I always kept it on vibrate and it worked great!! (The base broke on that one). This one sucks, it just won’t lock in on the note. Honestly it’s pretty worthless sound a string and it bounces all around and never locks in, if it does you sound the string again to check and it bounces all around again... worthless! (And yes, I have replaced the battery and tried different positions on my headstock... no good)
customer_reviews.author: Mike M.

customer_reviews.title: Bought for my ukulele by mistake, still works great
customer_reviews.text: The description says this is for "Guitar, Bass & Violin," which I didn't notice until now. I bought this for my ukulele and it works great. Apparently, the SN6X model is for a ukulele, but I don't know if there'd be a difference. I really like how this tuner is lightweight and even works in a noisy room. Does what it says!
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: one of the best inexpensive clip on tuners out there.
customer_reviews.text: this model Snark is bare bones... but it's easy to use, easy to read and for 9$ you get a great back-up tuner to keep in your gig bag for the times you forget to bring your #1 tuner. (oh, and you're not out $50 when someone "borrows" your tuner and "forgets" it was yours. ha. I've got a handful of other more expensive Snark tuners, and yes they are a bit faster, have more features and perhaps more accurate, but hey, you pay more, you get more.
customer_reviews.author: LA Hillbilly

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I use it with a Cordoba C9 and have had no problems or complaints. I do leave keep it clipped to the head stock. When I think I'm out of tune I just re-clip and re-tune. Several months in now and the original battery is still good. I think this is one of the better values in essential accessories out there. I can barely imagine playing without one !
customer_reviews.author: Slo-Hand

customer_reviews.title: Super convenient, game changer
customer_reviews.text: I never thought I’d review an electric guitar tuner because they all have seemed the same to me. This is the first non-plug-im tuner I have ever purchased, and I was leary. In short, it’s a game changer. So easy. Since I’m not too concerned with the aesthetics I don’t mind it being permanently clipped on. Very handy, and it does an incredible job of cutting through room noise except for bass guitars which seem to interfere with it more than nearby guitars for some reason.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Travis Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Works great on a 5 string banjo.
customer_reviews.text: I got tired of having to use the same Snark which usually is in a different case other than the instrument I currently use, so I decided to buy another for my banjo. Works as expected and the same as any Snark. I've used other electronic tuners and the Snarks seem to be the easiest as you can tell when you're getting close to the correct pitch.
customer_reviews.author: Lyle Landstrom

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after a couple weeks
customer_reviews.text: Had it in my guitar case and it wouldn't turn on one day. Thought the batteries were dead or something so I replaced them. Still doesn't work. Only been a few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: AndKnt

customer_reviews.title: Too bad
customer_reviews.text: The tuner works fine, when it works. After a year or so the 6 tuner I bought for my music classroom began to die. One after another they began to read every note as F. New batteries did not help. I’m very disappointed with this product and the reliability of Snark. Wasted money.
customer_reviews.author: Sourdough Baker

customer_reviews.title: Great for string instrument players
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping. Packaging was great. The product was as shown in picture, correct color and all. Works great. This is the second one I buy. This time for friend who is always borrowing mine. He has a guitar tuner and also does it by ear, but this is just handier, and is more precise. It can also be helpful to learn how to tune the guitar when you don't have a tuner on hand. But I carry mine. It's small enough to take along. Like I said, I had one already, and it has worked perfectly fine for the past two years without a problem. Even comes with batteries.
customer_reviews.author: German

customer_reviews.title: Covid has made orders take, forever.
customer_reviews.text: It is so much nicer to pick up your Guitar and tune it quickly. Then you don't have to spend the next hour trying to get it right, instead of practicing. Nowadays it's hard enough to find time to practise, let alone tuning by ear. Guitar tuning fluctuates on it's own daily, depending on weather. Hard to tune by ear then.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: A deaf person would love this tuner!
customer_reviews.text: Well........let me start off by saying this tuner makes me look like I know how to tune in my guitar like a pro. I really can’t say it works because I’m taking the tuner’s word for it. Not like I am qualified to call it out unless I bought another tuner to cross examine it.......you know what, just buy it and try it out!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle L Wangler

customer_reviews.title: Affordable, easy to use Guitar Tuner for Beginners or Pros
customer_reviews.text: The Snark SN5X Clip-On Tuner is an affordable, well made, easy to use guitar tuner for beginners or pros. It's so great to use that I actually leave it permanently clipped on to my guitar. The battery life is awesome, haven't had to change the battery yet. Love that it has a clear easy to read digital display in full color.
customer_reviews.author: HearMeOut

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight clip-op tuner that does what it's supposed to
customer_reviews.text: Super handy to have. The tuner weighs practically nothing so I often just leave it clipped onto the guitar. I can sightly feel its weight on the ukulele, but the ukulele is also much smaller. Otherwise, not much to say. The read-outs are fast and consistent, and they don't jump all over the place with each strum. There are several other models offered by this brand at slightly higher prices, but for the life of me, I can imagine what other features one could want from a tuner.
customer_reviews.author: David Sorkin

customer_reviews.title: Does the job well. Easy to read.
customer_reviews.text: Really like it, to be picky though, I has a slight delay (OK really slight) compared to my tuners that sense from the pickups. Just the second it takes for the string vibrations to get to the tuner clipped on the headstock. Not an issue and it is accurate to the other three tuners I have accumulated over the years; still gave it 5 stars,
customer_reviews.author: S. Gilchrest O'Neill

customer_reviews.title: Best guitar tuner yet
customer_reviews.text: I own several other guitar tuners but I don't use them much anymore. I now own 4 of this tuner. This tuner is the fastest tuner to acquire that I have ever used. It is repeatable and doesn't jump all over the placed trying to decide what note I'm really playing. Consequently, I can tune a guitar faster that I have ever been able to do it before.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Petsch

customer_reviews.title: Great tuner! Be aware its not vibration based
customer_reviews.text: Great tuner. Very compact, and folds up into itself when your not using it. It is chromatic, so you won't have to worry about accidently tuning your guitar to a banjo tuning before you realize it. The only thing is that it is not vibration based, so eveyone around you will need to be silent in order to get a good tuning.
customer_reviews.author: Tristan

customer_reviews.title: Third One a  Charm?
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Snark tuning device. On one hand, I love them. Easy, quick, and fits on my guitar headstock. What a great idea! But, this is my third one as the socket joint keeps breaking for no apparent reason. I like the idea of the swiveling head, easily turning to meet my playing position, but, the breaks are frustrating. So, I give it a rating of five for how easy it makes tuning, but a one for how it hold together...average a three rating.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Hastings

customer_reviews.title: Takes Some Of The Fun Away
customer_reviews.text: I mean, isn’t that the best part of the show, when the musicians tune up for 15 minutes? This works, probably better than I will know. I rarely use it. I have always tuned successfully and quickly by ear. I go by an mp3 that gives you something to go by, standard or dropped tuning. I also don’t play in a band, it might be more valuable in that situation. I was told by another musician that had never heard me play before that all guitarists need one of these, that’s the only reason I bought it. But it’s good quality and I am glad I have it.
customer_reviews.author: AlphonselTop Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: Go up one level
customer_reviews.text: If you're gonna spend the money on a Snark product by the Super Snark. It's easier to read and it's a little more accurate and I tried this particular 1 on 3 of my guitars and they didn't ring out the same on the chord until I switched it out with my super Snark and retuned the guitars then we were back to normal. They're off just a little bit.
customer_reviews.author: Kelley Smith

customer_reviews.title: There is no metronome.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this tuner as the description states that there is a built in metronome. However, there are no directions on how to activate it and when I wrote to the company for clarification, I never received a response. Not worth returning. The tuning on this is okay. Tends to make everything sharp.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: The accuracy seems fine for my purposes
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for traveling. I knew I would be playing other people's classical acoustics with no electronics. But I continue to use it for my bass and my electric guitar since it is even easier than a tuner pedal. The accuracy seems fine for my purposes. It is easy to read. According to an online test I did, my hearing is at the limits of the human ability to discern pitch variations. I grew up playing the violin and that helps. If you have no access to inbuilt electronics, this works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Deardon

customer_reviews.title: worked great!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I tried the more expensive brand first. it was complicated and I did not like it. but this baby is a third of the cost and works like a charm. I used it on my martin d-28 guitar it was perfect and easy to use. my guitar is in perfect tune. I do not play with other players. but I do use harmonicas in varies keys and it is in perfect tune
customer_reviews.author: John G.

customer_reviews.title: Easiest Tuning Ever.
customer_reviews.text: Makes it super easy to tune your guitar, and it's so inexpensive. Mine has been through a lot of use so far and it's still working fine. I recommend you pluck the string and then watch the gauge as you twist the tuning knob, without plucking again until you need to. It seems that this method gives the best and fastest response. Also, since it sits so conveniently on the head of your guitar, it can be easy to forget to turn it off after you've tuned. Don't forget - you want your batteries to last. Mine are still going strong after a few months.
customer_reviews.author: David Volk

customer_reviews.title: Always in tune
customer_reviews.text: For my amateur strumming butt this thing is great. With lack of instruction I’m glad I’ve got a degree on YouTube. The new guitar I have is now always in tune.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan walker

customer_reviews.title: Good Tuner But Not For Long
customer_reviews.text: I found this tuner to be accurate and easy to use but it did stand up to even light use. The tuner is plastic and has a cup that fits over the mounting bracket. The plastic cut is too brittle and broke. Today I came back from a trip and found the tuner was not working. I assumed it was the battery but it was not. It simply stopped working. So I see this purchase as a waste of money. What is the point of purchasing something that you can not rely on. My recommendation is spend a bit more with the hope that it will last more than a month.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Tuner!
customer_reviews.text: This is easy to use and can quickly get swapped to other instruments. Just clip on the headstock and play a note on an electric or acoustic and it gives you a really accurate result. Uses 2032 batteries which are easy to find - if you are gigging, be sure to bring spares! You can get to playing and forget to turn it off!
customer_reviews.author: E Peterson

customer_reviews.title: For banjos, too!
customer_reviews.text: I love this tuner. It is so easy to clip on, easy to turn on and off, and a breeze to tune your instrument. In my experience, they last forever ... I have one on each instrument. The one thing I don't understand is why the banjo is not one of the instruments that is included as tunable with this tuner. It works just fine!
customer_reviews.author: Monelle M. Richmond

customer_reviews.title: The do not last long
customer_reviews.text: Last one I purchased was the end of 2019 and it quit today. The electronics faded out. I tried two batteries that were tested first to be sure and it is the tuner. Snark tuners work for a couple weeks. Is it worth continually replacing, no not in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: bmark

customer_reviews.title: We have a SNARK for every guitar we own.
customer_reviews.text: Been using SNARK tuners for years on guitars, basses and ukulele. They are handy and accurate, but you have to make sure to get a TIGHT grip on the instrument. If it's not reading, adjust position. For the money, I don't think there's a better guitar tuner out there. Gonna try the "tight-grip" version when we need another.
customer_reviews.author: J. RodinoTop Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: No Tap Tempo Metronome on the SN5X
customer_reviews.text: Beware! I specifically bought this tuner because the product description has a chart indicating the SN5x has a Tap Tempo Metronome. It does not. The tuner works fine and the display is easy to see.
customer_reviews.author: bbb

customer_reviews.title: Accurate, but not a very precise tuner.
customer_reviews.text: The tuner is easy to use and easy to read. Unfortunately the very wide green zone of acceptable tuning does not allow for very precise tuning. This means that the tuner is accurate, but with a large margin of error. I did simultaneous tuning with my old Korg tuner which is more precise and clearly shows differences within the green zone of the Snark. For a quick tune that is probably good enough for most uses, this tuner is fine. If you want more precise tuning, you might need something else.
customer_reviews.author: Linus Linder

customer_reviews.title: Great price
customer_reviews.text: I love these tuners and this was way cheaper than buying the same one at the guitar store. Only thing I don’t like is that they never seem to work when you try to put a new battery in. Not a big deal cuz a new one is really cheap if you buy it on amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Lydia Flora

customer_reviews.title: Love these tuners
customer_reviews.text: I have several of these tuners for both my guitars and ukuleles - they are awesome to use and accurate - the price is so reasonable that I buy them often for myself and others - highly recommend these tuners - for the price you can't go wrong
customer_reviews.author: RC

customer_reviews.title: powers on but doesn't actually work.
customer_reviews.text: It does not display the notes. Had to buy a replacement for this and am stuck with this non-returnable dud. Very disappointed. Buyer beware. Snark does not seem to allow returns of defective items for some reason. Thank god, it was only $9. Or perhaps, I should have spent more for a quality item.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Snark will not comunicate with their customers and their email does not respond
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tuner and after 6 months it died. I replaced the battery and nothing. I tried another battery and still nothing happened. I sent a email as instructed in the enclosed info. Nothing happened. I sent another and nothing happened. Zero response. I forgot about it and pulled it out of my gig bag and tried again and I have still not had a response from Snark. It seem that they will not communicate with their customers. Doc
customer_reviews.author: donald childress

customer_reviews.title: Better than the previous version
customer_reviews.text: This newer version is brighter and easier to read than the previous version. Nothing wrong with the previous version, but it was improved nonetheless.
customer_reviews.author: Tuneup

product_meta.title: Snark SN5X Clip-On Tuner for Guitar, Bass & Violin (Current Model)
product_meta.description: Style:Snark SN5X Guitar TunerSnark SN5X Clip-On Tuner for Guitar, Bass & Violin (Current Model)
feature_bullets: Features frequency range tailored to guitar and bass
Tuner can be used on front of back of headstock,Rotates 360°

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars19,616 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
